title: 1 bedroom Bungalow type rental off street parking
description: 1 bedroom Bungalow type rental, off street parking, 5 minutes to NE Turnpike and minutes to beltsville state park. Quiet area.Water sewer appliances included Refrigerator washer dryer This is a truly spacious and well appointed property with countless original craftsman details from floor to ceiling. It offers a large and inviting vegetation filled living space decorated in a neutral palette and basking in tons of natural light. Ideal for yoga and meditation, a sunlit den can be found near the formal dining area leading to the kitchen. The house has tremendous character with crown moldings, large bay windows, a big brass chandelier, a towering brick fireplace and hardwood floors throughout. The kitchen is stocked with everything you could possibly need to cook or bake and features a lovely breakfast nook. The unit also offers a private front yard decked with a basket ball hoop, a stationary bike, a built-in bbq and resort style patio furnitures. There is storage galore, an on-site washer & dryer, a private 2 vehicles garage as well as ample street parking on all three streets framing the building. The available bedroom is the largest of all three and can be found at the end of the hallway. It features large french doors than open up to the front yard, giving its occupant the option of a private entrance.

title: Gorgeous Duplex 2 Bed 1 Bath Apartment In Philadelphia
description:
1535 Fairmount Ave
Gorgeous Duplex 2 Bed 1 Bath Apartment In Philadelphia!! Open kitchens with the cookies and cream granite counter tops enhanced by the numerous espresso cabinets, are a perfect back drop for the family meals. Central AC/Heat system, a bright and an open floor plan, a smart home application to regulate lighting, Wi-Fi extender and surround sound. Washer/dryer, water, parking, snow plowing. No smoking. Pets Ok. $1050 Plus utilities, Close to shopping centers and parks. If you are interested please TEXT ME your number
My name is Brook (), I’m new in town from Boulder, Colorado and I’m looking for a great, friendly household to join starting between now and October 1st. Budget around $900-$1,000 plus or minus. I would love to have a wonderful home community to return to after a day of work and life outside the house, loving life in Bend, and occasionally have dinner together or head out with our friends to the many great events around town. Either a mix of genders or all guys is great. I am seeking a clean place where I feel comfortable having friends over occasionally for hanging out, card games and dinner. A bit about me- I'm a cheerful, clean, creative, fun outdoorsy guy and I enjoy a peaceful and positive community household with people with active lives anywhere from late 20s to early 40s. As a housemate I'm flexible, tidy, aware of others, clean up after myself (particularly in the kitchen), load and run the dishwasher and sweep, can compromise and accommodate, and I tend to lift the energy of the room. No drugs, little drinking. I love biking everywhere, swimming, trail running, kayaking, casual rock climbing, adventuring and exploring. I have worked in education, youth development and team leadership, and I've lived in France, Spain, Mexico and Germany and I speak those languages plus Brazilian Portuguese. I don't watch TV. I have steady income from properties in Boulder, CO, I'll be looking for a job in customer service or youth development, and pay rent on time. I already got set up socially here in Bend and play adult dodgeball, volleyball, am bouldering at the Circuit and do the Thursday night cruiser ride, and I'm eager to get out for some karaoke. IN NEED OF A RENTAL HOUSE- 3-BEDROOM. For 3Adults & 1Child. HAVE GREAT REFERENCES!!! 30+Years with housing authority of Snohomish County,(section 8). The Rent is paid on the 1st of each month ALWAYS! 3-Adults and 1-Child. We have NO PETS! Looking North End of Lynnwood to Everett. PLEASE if you or someone you may know has a 3-Bedroom Rental home for rent 🙏 Contact me as soon as possible by phone or by email. Phone is best though. Thanks so much.Hello! Hoping to find someone with some land that I can rent a small space from so I can set up a tent! It’s not a big tent and I don’t need any amenities. I’ll pay a agreed upon amount weekly. I pretty much just need a place to keep my stuff during the day and a place to sleep at night. I’m a clean person and I stay out of trouble!! Let me know thx Where to start well lets see i am posting this for me and my disabled parents i am disabled as well so yeah and we have a blue heeler dog he is 8 years old we need a long term place to park are rv it is an 07 alfa gold 5th wheel it is 39 feet long with 3 tipouts we can't afford a lot but if all the utilities are included that's a big plus and we have 2 pickups and a mini van ho before i forget we are also crafters we make and sell thinks some on the internet some with 10 by 10 awning and tables so we can get space for that would be nice well anyway thanks for looking. Im looking for room. I can trade work for rest of month and pay next month. I remodel homes and do landscaping. I’m 41. Single and just me. No pets. Hopefully you have pup. I have some work in Corvallis. I like exploring ares. I cook. I’m not messy person. Seeking rental, preferably out of town, but doesn’t have to be if it’s the right place. Quiet, respectful, middle aged and indoor, clean, well-trained cats looking for long term rental. Seeking the same - Quiet & respectful landlord/set-up. I have lived on a landlord's property for years and have excellent references. Please text or call. Thank you. We are a couple looking for a place to sleep. Sleeping in cars has gotten pretty old the last 9 months and despite having over 12,000 dollars saved up over the course of those 9 months, we still don’t qualify to rent anything anywhere. I have poor credit due to letting a car repair credit card slip accidentally (and I’m bad at bureaucracy and have no idea how to repair it) and she’s been at the DoorDash game for less than a year. We both do DoorDash all day every day. She rises early and sleeps about 10pm latest. I rise late and dash til I crash about 3/4am. We each pull in about 1k/week. We both hustle. I’m drug and alcohol free and she smokes pot but only at night before bed and wouldn’t bring it out of her property/car. We wouldn’t be around too much. We just want a place to sleep and finding housing is near impossible in this county. We just got back from burning man and are a little tired and looking for an actual bed. (I’m pretty much required to go every year. I help build ‘the temple’ and am fairly keyed in for life in my role on that crew) Thinking of springing for a hotel for a few days but figured I’d beg here again. Nothing against port orchard or poulsbo, but the dashing game is Bremerton and silverdale so ideally we’d want to be closer to there and not have a long drive but honestly we’ll take anything. We’d like to keep it less than 1k per month. 2 adults. No drama. She’s boring, I’m a cult leader and fun, we won’t be around much. Room, shower, laundry but not really required. We ain’t fancy. We just want a place to sleep. A place to take off from and a place to land. We have two cars. We dash together from 5-9pm otherwise….we off alone in our own cars. We ARE rampant smokers but will do this outside the home and likely in our own vehicles. We’re big o. Self reliance and leaving no trace. We’d of liked an apartment but perfect credit required and working your job longer than 9months is apparently a thing….and we can’t keep paying 50 dollars over and over again to places that have had 15+ people apply before us. Will start with emails and then go face to face over lunch or something. Facebook stalk me at buck bandersnatch or google “uncle Buck” and “burning man” and I’m sure one of the stupid videos people have made will turn up. We’ll stick with just us-images from burning man this time. That’s where we met. That’s where my role and soul lies. It’s a long story but temple comes first. We burn it down, yes. We have to. It’s how tangential zen crap works. Good times.

This beautiful three-story home is located in the heart of Fishtown, which Forbes Magazine described as one of the best neighborhoods to live in the U.S.!
The home has a recently remodeled kitchen with a ton of natural lighting, stainless steel appliances, a built-in dishwasher and a wrap around counter for eating, working or hanging out.
There is hard wood flooring throughout the home with a smart Nest thermostat which operates the gas heat and electric central air conditioning. Water is included in your rent. There is full semi-finished basement for storage and laundry.
The patio is also in the process of an update, with a new Moroccan style, tiled wall being built. Included are older and recent pictures of the yard to give you a sense of the space.
There are a total of three bedrooms and two full bathrooms. The second floor has one large bedroom and one smaller bedroom, as well as a full bathroom.  The third floor master bedroom runs the entire length of the house and also has it's own newly renovated full bathroom with a large soaking bathtub.
This listing is furnished, but if you prefer unfurnished, let us know!
Parking:
There's street parking available with no time limit and no permit required.
We are walking distance to the Market-Frankford line, which will quickly take you to Center City, University City, Old City, South Philly, and more ($2.25 token fee). Lyft and Uber are always nearby and typically arrive in ~3 minutes. We are also close to I 95 as well.
